item.title: Miriam add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "You cannot simultaneously prevent and prepare for war." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Anton LaVey
item.description: "Stupidity—The top of the list for Satanic Sins. The Cardinal Sin of Satanism. It’s too bad that stupidity isn’t painful. Ignorance is one thing, but our society thrives increasingly on stupidity. It depends on people going along with whatever they are told. The media promotes a cultivated stupidity as a posture that is not only acceptable but laudable. Satanists must learn to see through the tricks and cannot afford to be stupid." -- Anton LaVey

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Without friends, no one would want to live, even if he had all other goods." -- Aristotle

item.title: Miriam add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "This is my knife. It is very sharp and very eager to hurt you." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "A man can live and be healthy without killing animals for food; therefore, if he eats meat, he participates in taking animal life merely for the sake of his appetite. And to act so is immoral." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
item.description: "Joy is the infallible sign of the presence of God." -- Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Tolstoy Leo
item.description: "If you want to be happy, be." -- Tolstoy Leo

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Exactly!" said Deep Thought. "So once you do know what the question actually is, you'll know what the answer means." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If everyone fought for their own convictions there would be no war." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Happiness does not depend on outward things, but on the way we see them." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by George Lucas
item.description: "So this is how liberty dies. With thunderous applause." -- George Lucas

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Life did not stop, and one had to live." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "A man is like a fraction whose numerator is what he is and whose denominator is what he thinks of himself. The larger the denominator, the smaller the fraction." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Boredom: the desire for desires." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Which is worse? the wolf who cries before eating the lamb or the wolf who does not." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Rita Rudner
item.description: "I love to sleep. Do you? Isn't it great? It really is the best of both worlds. You get to be alive and unconscious." -- Rita Rudner

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "To get rid of an enemy one must love him. " -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Never tell your enemy he is doing the wrong thing." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "There will be today, there will be tomorrow, there will be always, and there was yesterday, and there was the day before..." -- Leo Tolstoy
